title: WCAS HISTORY 300-0-30 New Lectures in History
topic: Religion and Deviance in Latin America

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Examining topics as varied as witchcraft, backwoods preachers, and Tijuana folk saints, we will discuss how local actors worked out the boundaries of religious orthodoxy with state and ecclesiastical authorities in Latin America, ca. 16th century to the present. Along the way, we will also investigate the religious roots of our current conceptions of race and gender. Classes will consist of brief lectures and ample time for (semi-)directed discussions.
